author: GamingBolt
description:
Developing a game can be a really tricky job. Video games take a lot of time and effort to make, and there are a lot of moving parts involved in the process. While it’s majorly clear what makes a game tick, sometimes it happens that developers make worse decisions and develop something that isn’t innovative in the slightest. 

It can occur due to a disconnect between what the fan base expects and what the developer delivers, or maybe iterating without innovation, or maybe just a poor development cycle. 

With this video, we will be taking a look at 15 such cases of games where the developers actually ended up “making it worse”!
title: 15 Times Game Devs Said “LET'S MAKE IT WORSE” And Actually Did

author: GamingBolt
description:
For numerous reasons, player perception of games prior to even a minute’s play can be damning. This isn’t a video on how you should all give Marathon a chance though, no. Instead, we’re aiming to highlight games that visually might look unimpressive, or mechanically may appear shallow, or conceptually or thematically might seem repetitive or over-explored. 

The games featured here harbour more beneath their presentation. Furthermore, they’ve delighted legions of fans – some of which into the millions – via their innovative gameplay, engrossing stories, wonderful characters, inventive mechanics, or a combination of them all. 

To bottom line: first impressions can be deceiving, and it’s in playing these games that their true power comes to the fore beyond what they initially appear to be about.
title: 15 Games That Are BETTER Than They Look
